subject: Re: Can We Post Msgs In QuikScript?
msgSnippet: ... mail as html. ... click the mail format tab. ... [snip] Thanks Ed.  I get it now.  I ve been in various Yahoo eGroups for years, but whenever I join a
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Edward M Gaddy" <egaddy@c...>
wrote:
> hi,
>
> usually your e-mail program will have an option to send and receive
mail as html.
>
> if you have outlook 2003 go to the tools menu, then options, then
click the mail format tab.
>
> then you'll be able to send in html.
>
> or for an individual message from outlook go to format and select html.
>
> cCz
>
> ed
>
>
[snip]

Thanks Ed. I get it now. I've been in various Yahoo eGroups for
years, but whenever I join a group, I always set my preference to
"Daily Digest". Then, if I want to post a message or respond to
someone else's message, I log into the Yahoo eGroup web site and post
my message there. So my eGroup messages never originate from my email
account. I least I understand now how it's done.

Jeff

Thanks Ed.  I get it now.  I've been in various Yahoo eGroups for
years, but whenever I join a group, I always set my preference to
"Daily Digest".  Then, if I want to post a message or respond to
